meaningMnemonic: When a <radical>prison</radical> holds the <radical>sun</radical> inside it, everything will always be <kanji>in season</kanji>. Obviously if the sun is in prison, the seasons can't change. Want to eat perfect apples all year round? Just put the sun in prison when they're ripe — usually a short window of <kanji>ten days</kanji>.
readingMnemonic: When things are <kanji>in season</kanji> for more than <kanji>ten days</kanji>, people are going to wonder what's going on. When's Christmas? When's Golden Week? <reading>Soon</reading> (しゅん), you say. Soon enough, it's <reading>June</reading> (じゅん). Which is the middle of the year, so now everything is soon.
